result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice J Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, penalties and surcharges, including DNA surcharges.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 12/1/15 and additional payments due the 1ST of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  Fine is set at $200.00. Fine is to be paid from the cash seized from the defendant on the date of the offense.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. Defendant must enroll in a program within one week from 10/23/15.
Maintain fulltime employment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction; release for work, school, child care and elder care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice J Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/ EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. Defendant must enroll in a program within one week from 10/23/15.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, penalties and surcharges, including DNA surcharges.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 12/1/15 and additional payments due the 1ST of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  Fine is set at $200.00. Fine is to be paid from the cash seized from the defendant on the date of the offense.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction; release for work, school, child care and elder care.

REPORT on 10/30/15 at 5:00 pm. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Sentencing documents on behalf of the defendant received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle. Paul Hauer on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, the victim  and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-23-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Defense counsel request case set for plea and sentencing.   Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing on 09-15-2015 at 08:30 am, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Stark.  Court vacates previous dates scheduled.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/5/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17, in room 310 of the safety building.  Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requests a date for status.  Case adjourned for status on 7/27/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8/6/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is looking for some additional information.  Defense requests a trial date.  Case adjourned for status on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 8/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court will set a final pretrial date at the next court date.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Court is in trial.  State has provided additional discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/10/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All motions to be filed by the next court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice J Collins in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Marissa Santiago for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.
